adjectives.description: commensurate (comparative more commensurate, superlative most commensurate)

entries.meaning: Of a proportionate or similar measurable standard.
(physics) Describing a crystal in which every atom or molecule is placed in the same relative position

verbs.description: commensurate (third-person singular simple present commensurates, present participle commensurating, simple past and past participle commensurated)

entries.meaning: To reduce to a common measure.

examples: The rare temper and proportion, which the Church of England useth in commensurating the Forms of Absolution to the degrees of preparation and necessity, is to be observed
